summary: The COVID-19 pandemic required a major federal response. But even before that, the federal government's long-term fiscal path was unsustainable because debt was growing faster than the economy. Under our projections, the debt will reach its highest point in history in 2028 and continue to grow faster than gross domestic product. title: The Nation’s Fiscal Health: After Pandemic Recovery, Focus Needed on Achieving Long-Term Fiscal Sustainability
